content: Mac, PC. People get into such heated debates. Me, I prefer the PC, but have used Mac's as well. They are well designed, and are great for video editing as well as for pictures. They both have their advantages and disadvantages, and either one of them is far from horrible. I can not stand Windows Vista. Instead of taking something great and making it better, they made it worse. The damn thing begs for permission to do simple tasks. Lord help you if you want to uninstall it. It cries, moans and groans, and will do everything to prevent you from removing it. You can thank Mac for the IPod as well. Great innovation. Bad Vista Bad Vista . I've evicted Vista, and welcomed back XP. Happy April fools day to you all. Good thread Knele.

content: quote: Originally posted by shades_of_grey: Meh, I like Vista. It's always worked well for me. Imho, Macs are for the technologically-retarded. Vista works fine. Most boxes shipped with Vista don't have enough RAM. You need at least 2Gb to run it right and 4Gb if you're doing graphics or something heavy like games. If the UAC bugs you, just turn it off.

title: Apple switches Macs to Windows

content: SOG, and Thud. Has Vista really improved that much since it's first release? I'm sure there have been subsequent updates since I have last used it. Vista gobbles up more RAM than anything. All for what? Some extra eye candy, an annoying "UAC", and some extra security features? I could, with an XP system, devote more memory to whatever tasks are at hand. And if I want to throw a game in there, I do not have to worry about 2 GB of my RAM being eaten up by the OS and system processes, and the other 2 for the Game, vs something like 1GB, and 3GB respectively. A comparison would be nice, if you two folks wouldn't mind. I am itching to build another system. The one I have now is great, and basically trouble free with XP. I am considering the Phenom II X4. Nothing but solid performance from AMD for me.

content: Vista has to be the worst and best PC at the same time. The intent was to build an idiot proof machine for the majority that just point and click follow time consuming instructions, never do anything with it but e-mail and internet,never change settings, and pick up the phone if they have a problem. And that they did its idiot proof Point click and read instructions, while beefing up thier extended service contract Sales. The crowd they catered to wouldnt even know they had a problem till the F thing crashed and was inoperable. But the proof that its a POS is the fact that businesses started switching to MACs and apple. Thats why a new version is schedualed for this year.

content: Windows Vista stinks. I have a Mac and a sony laptop running Vista. Mac is faster and easy to use and I don't have to spend all that money on spam and Virus software but it is not as easy as it seems. Vista on the other hand is slow, complicated at times, and one needs all kinds of virus, spam and firewalls to be fully protected.

title: Apple switches Macs to Windows

content: quote: Originally posted by Boilerman_01: SOG, and Thud. Has Vista really improved that much since it's first release? I'm sure there have been subsequent updates since I have last used it. Vista gobbles up more RAM than anything. All for what? Some extra eye candy, an annoying "UAC", and some extra security features? I could, with an XP system, devote more memory to whatever tasks are at hand. And if I want to throw a game in there, I do not have to worry about 2 GB of my RAM being eaten up by the OS and system processes, and the other 2 for the Game, vs something like 1GB, and 3GB respectively. A comparison would be nice, if you two folks wouldn't mind. I am itching to build another system. The one I have now is great, and basically trouble free with XP. I am considering the Phenom II X4. Nothing but solid performance from AMD for me. Original Vista was a slow dog. Vista is much improved with the addition of SP1 and SP2 is coming out in April I think. Vista never will be what it was originally meant to be but it is still an improvement over XP. I think the upcoming Windows 7 will be closer to what we were all hoping for. XP will only recognize 3Gb of RAM no matter what you put in the box and it will only utilize 2Gb for most applications. Vista will recognize 4Gb and it can access all of it. Vista doesn't hog your resources like XP. Vista will also need a graphics card that can support DirectX 9.0c with at least 128MB of onboard memory. For a comparison between all three systems, go here: >http://blogs.zdnet.com/hardware/?p=3236&page=2 Right now I'm runnig an AMD 64 system and it rocks. Having said that, I think that Intel has the overall speed advantage right now but when you compare the Phenom II X4 to it's Intel equivalent, the Core i7 940, it's a pretty close match and when you compare costs, it wins hands down. The real speed freak is the Intel QX9770 but it's very expensive and it runs hot so to take advantage you probably need liquid cooling. Get out your calculator and decide if you really need all that speed. Actually, I think a Linux OS variant like Ubuntu beats 'em all (including OS X which is really just a cut down Linux for Mac) as far as stability, and the ability to get the OS tuned optimally but it's still a bit too geeky for prime time and most of the applications I need won't run on it. Linux also suffers from the fact that major outfits like Adobe won't port a version to Linux native but I think that will change in the future. Best of all, Linux is free. Linux can access as much RAM as you can stuff into the box. Hope this helps a bit.
